meanings.definition: The practice of controlling a group or organization through authoritarian or dictatorial means.
meanings.sent1: In some companies, bossism can lead to unhappy employees and low morale.
meanings.sent2: The bossism in that company is so strong that no one dares to speak up against the leader.
meanings.sent3: The bossism in the office was so extreme that even the office plants seemed afraid.
meanings.sent4: The bossism in the classroom was like a dark cloud, stifling creativity and independent thinking.
meanings.sent5: The bossism of the principal was palpable, casting a shadow over the entire school.

meanings.definition: The influence or power exerted by a boss or leader within a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: Her bossism in the team ensured that her ideas were always implemented.
meanings.sent2: The bossism of the CEO was evident in every decision made by the company.
meanings.sent3: His bossism at the family dinner table made him the undisputed ruler of the mashed potatoes.
meanings.sent4: The bossism of the coach was like a magnet, drawing all the players to follow his lead.
meanings.sent5: The bossism of the queen bee kept the hive in perfect harmony and order.
